Title: Israel creates closed military zone near border with Lebanon
Description: Israel authorities have declared several settlements near the border with Lebanon a closed military zone.

Title: Russians launch 'Shahed' from north, south
Description: Russian aggressors launched attack drones from the northern and southern directions.

Title: Ukraine does not need permission to use its own weapons to strike...
Description: Ukraine, as a sovereign state, can make its own decisions about striking targets in Russia with its own weapons, and the United States does not prohibit the use of American-made weapons in the border regions of the Russian Federation.

Title: Ukraine has allocated UAH 1.2 trillion for defense in eight month...
Description: In January-August 2024, UAH 1.2 trillion was allocated from the state budget for the security and defense sector, including UAH 152 billion in August.

Title: Ukrzaliznytsia overcomes consequences of night shelling in Mykola...
Description: Ukrzaliznytsia has temporarily changed the movement of trains 109, 110, 102, 101 due to the Russian shelling of Mykolaiv region on the night of September 30.

Title: Russians attack DTEK brigade with drone in Dnipropetrovsk region
Description: Russian invaders attacked DTEK's repair team with drones while it was working to repair damaged overhead lines near the front line in the Dnipro region.

Title: Russia moves no troops from Zaporizhzhia axis to regain lost area...
Description: Russian invasion forces have not brought any reinforcements to Kursk region from the operational area in southern Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia region.

Title: Zelensky: Ukraine preparing for 'special' Ramstein meeting
Description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine during a meeting with officials following his visit to the USA noted that the Ukrainian and American teams are working on what was discussed and are preparing for a meeting of the Ukraine Defense Contact Group.

Title: NATO countries should back Ukraine’s peace plan, not China’s init...
Description: Jens Stoltenberg, the outgoing NATO Secretary General, believes that the Allies should support the Ukrainian Peace formula rather than any alternative 'peace' proposals put forward by other countries.

Title: Singer Jamala's documentary gets Gold Dophin awards at Cannes fes...
Description: A Ukrainian documentary 'Jamala. Songs of Freedom' won at the Cannes Corporate Media & TV Awards.

Title: Sybiha to visit Poland on Tuesday
Description: Minister for Foreign Affairs Andrii Sybiha will visit Poland on Tuesday, October 1, as part of his ongoing tour across Eastern Europe.

Title: G7 voices support to Ukraine on anniversary of illegal annexation...
Description: Two years into Moscow's illegal annexation of parts of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson, and Zaporizhzhia regions, the foreign ministers of the Group of Seven expressed their support for Ukraine.

Title: Ukraine expects no rolling blackouts Tue
Description: Ukraine’s power grid operator Ukrenergo as no hourly power shutdowns scheduled for Tuesday, October 1.

Title: Russia leaves almost 1,000 libraries across Ukraine destroyed or ...
Description: Since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the enemy destroyed or damaged almost a thousand libraries home to more than 200 million Ukrainian books.

Title: Baerbock supports idea of West supplying long-range missiles to U...
Description: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock supports the idea of ​​the West supplying Ukraine with long-range missiles for self-defense, even though German Chancellor Olaf Scholz takes a different position on the issue.

Title: War update: 80 combat clashes along frontlines over past day, mos...
Description: Since the beginning of the day, there have been 80 combat clashes, with the most attacks occurring in the Lyman, Pokrovsk, and Toretsk sectors.

Title: Stoltenberg: Putin's nuclear talk shouldn't stop NATO backing Ukr...
Description: NATO members should not be deterred from providing increased military assistance to Ukraine due to Russian President Vladimir Putin's ‘reckless nuclear rhetoric.’

Title: Trump wants Ukraine to have more leverage in negotiations with Ru...
Description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump aims to strengthen Ukraine's position ahead of potential peace negotiations with Russia.

Title: Russian drone strikes village in Kherson region injuring two civi...
Description: A Russian drone attack on the village of Stanislav in Kherson region has left two people injured.

Title: Not a single day without Shahed attacks on Ukraine in September
Description: According to an analysis by the Ukrainian Air Force, Russia launched an average of 44 Shahed drones daily against Ukraine throughout September.

Title: Orbán seeks to organize Ukraine-Russia ‘peace summit’
Description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has held intensive talks with representatives from China and Brazil in an attempt to initiate a peace summit between Ukraine and Russia.

Title: Poland to raise Volyn tragedy in Ukraine's EU membership talks
Description: Poland intends to address the complex history in its relations with Ukraine, particularly regarding the exhumation of Polish victims of the Volyn tragedy, in the first section of negotiations about Ukraine’s membership in the EU.

Title: In Lysychansk, occupiers urging young people sign contracts with ...
Description: In the temporarily occupied city of Lysychansk in Luhansk region, Russian troops are encouraging youth to sign contracts with the Russian army after finishing school and reaching adulthood.

Title: Inspections of combat readiness begin in Belarus
Description: In Belarus, a new phase of combat readiness inspections for military units and formations began on September 30.

Title: Sybiha, Szijjártó discuss Zelensky's Victory Plan
Description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha and Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó discussed ways to achieve lasting peace, punish Russia, and implement President Volodymyr Zelensky's Victory Plan.

Title: SSU National Academy trains specialists to conduct special operat...
Description: The National Academy of the Security Service of Ukraine is set to train specialists who will be able to conduct special operations on a large scale.

Title: Invaders hit car with drone in Kupiansk, one wounded
Description: A man was injured in Kupiansk, Kharkiv region, as a result of a Russian drone attack on a car.

Title: Substations in Kharkiv and Zaporizhzhia regions were shut down du...
Description: During the day on September 29, power engineers restored power supply to 27,400 consumers who lost power due to hostilities and technological disruptions.

Title: Russians use heavy flamethrower system, guided bombs near aggrega...
Description: Russian troops are trying to use a heavy flamethrower system and drop guided bombs at the location of the Vovchansk Aggregate Plant.

Title: Enemy attacks Kherson with drones, man is injured

Title: Man is killed in Kupiansk as result of Russian FPV drone strike
Description: A man died in Kupiansk, Kharkiv region, as a result of a Russian FPV drone strike on the morning of September 30.

Title: Power supply interruptions in Kherson due to shelling
Description: In Kherson, as a result of shelling by Russian troops, there are power outages.

Title: No incidents on border with Belarus - border guards
Description: The State Border Guard Service of Ukraine records no incidents on the border with Belarus.

Title: Sybiha, Szijjarto launch talks in Budapest
Description: Foreign ministers of Ukraine and Hungary, Andrii Sybiha and Peter Szijjarto, started bilateral negotiations in Budapest.

Title: Russian passports imposed on Ukrainians under occupation have no ...
Description: The Ministry of Justice notes that Russian passports, which were forcibly handed to Ukrainians in the temporarily occupied territories, bear no legal force.

Title: Seven Ukrainian regions receive 600 generators in September
Description: This month, seven frontline regions received 600 power generators as part of humanitarian aid ahead of winter.

Title: Guerrillas sabotage Russia’s rail military supply route to Kursk ...
Description: Partisans from the ATESH underground resistance movement blew up the rail track along which Russian forces supply equipment and ammunition to the section of the front in Kursk region.

Title: Government lifts ban on AC use in state offices, external illumin...
Description: The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine has canceled the recommendation to state authorities and state-owned enterprises to stop using air conditioners, as well as external illumination of buildings and adjacent territories.

Title: Victory Plan to be presented to Ukrainians short of certain detai...
Description: Ukraine's Victory Plan, initiated by President Volodymyr Zelensky, will be presented to the Ukrainian public omitting some sensitive details.

Title: War update: 153 clashes along frontline, hostilities most intense...
Description: A total of 153 combat engagements have been reported from Ukrainian battlefields over the past day, with the developments being most tense in the Pokrovsk direction.

Title: Ukraine’s top diplomat to visit Hungary Sep 30
Description: Minister for Foreign Affairs Andrii Sybiha on Monday, September 30, will pay a working visit to Hungary for bilateral negotiations with his Hungarian counterpart, Peter Szijjarto.

Title: Kremlin trying to hide from public plans to increase war spending...
Description: Russian authorities are planning to further raise next year’s defense budget, while Kremlin officials are trying to focus public attention on scheduled social spending.

Title: Ukraine downs Russian missile, 67 kamikaze drones overnight Monda...
Description: Ukraine’s Defense Forces of Ukraine shot down a Kh-59/69 guided air missile and 67 Shahed one-way attack drones that the Russians launched since Sunday night.

Title: Russians shell Kherson region killing one person, injuring 12 oth...
Description: On September 29, one person was killed and 12 others were injured as Russian forces shelled Kherson region.

Title: Critical infrastructure facility ablaze due to Russian attack in ...
Description: On the night of Monday, September 30, a fire broke out at a critical infrastructure facility in Bashtanka district of Mykolaiv region as a result of a Russian attack.

Title: Russia’s combat losses in Ukraine up by 1,250 over past day
Description: The total combat losses of the Russian forces in Ukraine from February 24, 2022, to September 30, 2024, have reached approximately 653,060 troops, including 1,250 killed and wounded over the past day.

Title: Ukrainian prisoners held by Russia set to be focus of autumn PACE...
Description: The debates under urgent procedures and a resolution concerning persons missing due to Russian aggression—military prisoners and civilians—will be central topics.

Title: Enemy strikes Zaporizhzhia region over 390 times in past day
Description: Over the past day, the enemy launched 393 strikes on 10 settlements in Zaporizhzhia region.

Title: Attack on Kyiv lasted over five hours, no damage or casualties re...
Description: The Shahed drone attack on the capital lasted over five hours, and preliminarily, there is no reported damage or casualties in Kyiv.

Title: One Russian missile carrier ship remains on duty in Black Sea
Description: A single enemy ship, carrying Kalibr missiles, continues its combat duty in the Black Sea.

Title: Kyiv under massive drone attack, air defenses activated
Description: Explosions rang out in Kyiv as air defense systems targeted Shaheds.

Title: Police shut down channel for draft dodgers in Odesa region
Description: In Odesa region, law enforcement officials have shut down a channel that allowed draft dodgers to leave the country under the guise of truck drivers.

Title: Over 200 settlements occupied by Russians in Luhansk region have ...
Description: In Luhansk region, not a single grocery store operates in more than 200 settlements occupied by Russians.

Title: Attorneys General of Ukraine and United States discuss cooperatio...
Description: Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin held an official meeting with U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland and the U.S. Department of Justice team to discuss cooperation in priority areas.

Title: Reports of aid to Russia undermine China's declared neutrality on...
Description: Continued reports of China's aid to Russia's war effort undermine Beijing's attempts to depict itself as a neutral mediator in the war in Ukraine.

Title: In Ukraine, 490 settlements without electricity due to hostilitie...
Description: The situation in Ukraine's power system remains stable, with 490 settlements partially or completely de-energized as a result of hostilities and technological disruptions.

Title: Classified documents suggest Navalny could be poisoned while in p...
Description: Journalists obtained access to 'hundreds' of documents related to the death of Russian opposition leader Aleksei Navalny. Among the bulk, information was found indicating his possible poisoning.

Title: Russian airstrikes leave two injured in Kharkiv region’s Bohuslav...
Description: The Russian invasion force launched airstrikes on the village of Bohuslavka in Kharkiv region’s Izium district, injuring two civilians and inflicting damage on households and a farm.

Title: Russian drones target municipal transport in Kherson three times ...
Description: The Russian invasion army attacked public transport in Kherson, using drones, for the third time in a day.

Title: Both parties in U.S. Congress urge rethink of America’s Russia st...
Description: The bipartisan committee called on the U.S. government to abandon the status quo established after the end of the Cold War in relations with the Russian Federation, and label Moscow as a 'persistent' threat to global security.

Title: Zelensky's U.S. visit challenging yet successful – President’s Of...
Description: Head of the Ukrainian President’s Office Andriy Yermak says President Volodymyr Zelensky’s visit to the USA was challenging, yet crucial and successful.

Title: At next Ramstein, we need to decide how to increase pressure on R...
Description: In October, Ukraine and its partners are to identify joint steps and a common vision of how to increase pressure on Russia at the Ramstein Conference.

Title: Biden: Ukraine will win this war
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden has expressed confidence that Ukraine will win the fight against Russian military aggression.

Title: Woman killed, man wounded in Nikopol as result of Russian shellin...
Description: During the day, on September 29, Russian troops struck Nikopol district with heavy artillery and drones, killing a woman and wounding a man.

Title: Russians drop ammunition from drone in Kherson - man wounded
Description: A man was wounded in Kherson as a result of a drone dropping ammunition.

Title: Enemy shells two villages in Kherson region - civilians wounded
